title: Help with Sports Design Logo
content:
I’m trying to indetify the font used in the word TORREY PINES.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200705im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TPnikeVer2_6731.jpg)

 [‹ Looking for a digitised version of Touraine from Cassandre & Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200705/http:/typophile.com/node/34402 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sween & Salazar, Ltd. logo - Century Schoolbook {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200705/http:/typophile.com/node/34407 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vmh1976

comments.content:
I think this was done with [House Gothic23](http://web.archive.org/web/20070911200705/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=15&subpage=viewfonts) Condensed Bold, using the Alternate (traditional) R that comes with the collection. It’s shown in the printed flyer, but it might be hard to find on the web site.

- Mike Yanega

Oh, man.  
The R was what kept me from saying it’s House Gothic.
